Uh, Yanshosh. Iron Raptor is actually standing up by the window now. But you 
might have not gotten the post that states that so maybe we can just say 
that Prowl stood up and went to her? Just a small bit that fixes it all up, 
huh?


* Iron Raptor nodded but didn�t turn and watch Arcangle and Silver Sting 
leave, listening but also watching her finger trace small designs on the 
glass of the window.
Her mind was still reeling about Arcangles plan, thinking of just what she 
needed to do to pull it off smoothly. She already knew that they needed to 
repair the Ark and get those engines set up and online before they even 
thought of placing the Autobots in it. Not to mention they needed Iris to 
make up the proper auto-pilot system for the flight into the Earth�s orbit, 
something that was going to be the toughest part of this mission yet.
Iron Raptor shook her head slightly, there was so much to do and so much to 
worry about. In all her life she had never been so busy.
But then Felines voice broke through her concentration, tilting her head 
slightly in the fembots direction as she listened to her speak.*

� I don�t need to forgive you for anything, Feline. You have problems and 
we�ll just have to work around them until you bring them to an 
understanding.�

* She then watched Feline exit the room in the corner of her eye, then 
turning her head and looking out of the window again with a sigh. Her mind 
going back to the mission at hand as well as the one they had to get down to 
as soon as they got back.
Either mission couldn�t be too difficult, she had to admit that there were a 
fair amount of events that could go wrong but they would work around them.
But then she heard Felines dainty foot-steps again, wondering just why the 
fembot was returning for. But once she heard Feline speak she knew.*

� Room 6-20 and just up from the hallway where the armory is located. You 
can�t miss it.�

* Iron Raptor had actually paid attention to where Prowl had taken her after 
her Alliance ordeal, looking at the details of the rooms she passed and 
making note of their locations.
But now there were more important things to worry about, like thinking about 
the condition of Tavatron and Dinobot when they found them. Thinking about 
how close they would be to the Alliance base and how attack was more likely 
then anything else, lucky as hell if they weren�t.
Though, as her finger traced another pattern in the glass she felt a hand 
slip around her but knew whom it was. She would always know Prowl�s touch, 
and the feel of it nearly made her forget that he had gotten her back with 
an insult that had gone just a little bit too far.
Iron Raptor�s optics narrowed at the thought of that insult, knowing that 
she really wasn�t angry about it but a woman�s weight was a touchy thing and 
she didn�t like it made fun of. Though, her revenge for that insult wasn�t 
through yet.
But when she heard Prowl speak and looked up seeing her own reflection in 
the glass but actually looking at Prowls. *

� Yes. I�m going with Arangles plan. It�s fairly clever if you think about 
it long enough, and has a very high possibility of actually working.�


* Her mind was wondering again from the thoughts about their missions, 
actually dwelling on the feel of his touch instead of them. But then she 
shook her head slightly to clear it, reminding herself that she was still in 
the process of making him pay for that insult.
Iron Raptor looked down at his hand on her waist and then up at him, her 
expression being that of a look that reflected her words. *

� And just what do you think YOU�RE doing?�

* She put a hand on her hip and the other on his that was on her waist, her 
fingers working to pry each one of his from the grasp her had on her. *

� �Heavy as a TRUCK,� huh? Well, you think you can just come over here and 
touch me like this? I think not.�

* At the last word she finally pried his hand free and let it fall, then 
taking a few steps away from him and walked over to the projector and turned 
it off. Making sure that she swung her hips a bit while she had walked to 
tease him. *

� You�re going to pay for the insult, Mister. And this is your 
punishment�until you learn you lesson.�

* And it was, that he wasn�t allowed to touch her for a little bit. Of 
course she would stop once he learned his lesson, slag knew that she 
wouldn�t be able to keep this up forever. *
